result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L Brabender was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -CASH BOND APPLIED.  Forfeiture and costs totalling $330.50 - Paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew L Brabender

records.addlTxt:
1:10 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Maragret Vinz.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Vinz - State will amend to ordinance DC with a forfeiture and costs.  DA moves to amend to City of Markesan ordinance Disorderly Conduct in violation of 265-1 with a $100 forfeiture and costs.  Defendant concurs.  Atty Vinz enters a plea of NO CONTEST on behalf of the defendant to the amended charge.  Court finds the defendant guilty to the amended charge and sentences the defendant to $100 forfeiture plus costs.  Bond on file is to be applied to the forfeiture and costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan. 

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.
(State's)
Status hearing on October 30, 2018 at 11:30 am.
for Discovery (Defendant)
(Atty Margaret Vinz)

Defendant qualifies for PD representation.  Counsel will be appointed.

Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Corut questions defendant regarding address and employment.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  No Contact with the Shell Station in Markesan, WI.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 24, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.  Failure to appear will result in a warrant.
